intro: Senecio delbesianus, commonly known as the Delbesian groundseller, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Senecio delbesianus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and resilience.
